description:
Accept keypair when you launch a new server. These properties would be stored along with the other server properties in the database (like they are currently for ec2 api).

When a VM launches, the compute drivers can inject the key pair (or expose it via the metadata api)
title: Add keypairs to os api

comments.content:
Accept security group / keypair when you launch a new server. These properties would be stored along with the other server properties in the database (like they are currently for ec2 api). 

When a VM launches, the compute drivers can inject the key / control the security groups.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anotherjesse

comments.content: I already have a branch here at (https://code.launchpad.net/~tpatil/nova/add-remove-securitygroup-instance/+merge/71967) which accept security groups when you launch a server.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tpatil

comments.content: tpatil - reviewing your request - looks AWESOME
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anotherjesse

comments.content: removed the security groups from the linked branch, and did some other cleanup.  agreed, like the direction you took with secgroups, tushar.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sleepsonthefloor
